website_summaries.verdict: Multitouch in place of a mouse may not appeal to pro designers, but the Bamboo Fun Pen and Touch is an excellent choice for mobile users who want to begin dabbling with art tools.
pros: multitouch controls work seamlessly alongside pen

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet, use it when conducting training online
customer_reviews.text: This tablet works great. I use it when conducting training online and it helps me illustrate concepts. It's also pretty portable so I can carry it around in a backpack. Update: Make sure you have some bubble wrap for the little pen though, or something to keep the tip safe as you don't want to get the tip chipped, otherwise you'll need to replace the pen like me. But not to fret. If you lose the pen or damage it, you can just buy the pen replacement on amazon without having to replace the whole tablet
customer_reviews.author: beforethebop

customer_reviews.title: Great product, works well - bundled software is weak
customer_reviews.text: I have been using WACOM tablets for many many years... they are excellent. This upgrade (for me) is a huge improvement with the motion and gesture controls and pressure sensitivity increase for drawing and painting. Easy to work with and very durable. The COREL software Painter Essentials 4.0 has bugs in it - the slide draw disappears when used, the brushes do not work right and the update does not seem to fix any of this.(again this is not a WACOM issue - it's a COREL problem) - just thought I'd mention it. Great WACOM product - a must have for artists and digital photographers to create/edit your work that's easy and fun.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Incredible digitizer for the price
customer_reviews.text: At time of this writing this product is at unbelievable price ~ $120, I'm rating five stars just based on the value. However, I'm subtracting one of those stars for the noticeably rough active surface, which you sense as an annoying drag upon the pen tip as you draw. In the end, decided I could live with the over-rough surface, but ONLY because of the low cost; had this product cost me $200 I would have returned it immediately over this issue. Overall what makes this such a great deal is the physical footprint of the active area, fact that it also supports touch gestures, and comes with full license of Photoshop Elements
customer_reviews.author: Stockstradr

customer_reviews.title: Good, but with several major flaws
customer_reviews.text: The pen itself works great, to put it simply. Drawing is very pleasent, and makes graphic design easier fairly frequently. That is the most important thing in a tablet, so I give the tablet 4 stars overall because of that. Unfortunately, the pen's buttons are not TERRIBLY well placed (though not bad) and the rotate/zoom multitouch functions are difficult at best, and infuriating at worst. Single finger touch works quite well, but multitouch overall isn't worth anything, it usually just messes up whatever you're trying to do. I'd say if you want a tablet, this seems to be a good one, but it is not without flaws.
customer_reviews.author: David Rhyne

customer_reviews.title: so nice
customer_reviews.text: This is my first graphics tablet. I was looking for something that wasn't too small or too expensive but still had several configuration options and more levels of pressure sensitivity. While I haven't used it very extensively yet, it was actually very easy to transition from using a mouse for my graphics manipulation to this tablet. It offers so much more freedom and versatility than a mouse and I loved it right away. I think it was a good deal. I compared it to other smaller sized tablets, and I think this one is the best value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun is fun
customer_reviews.text: I have had the Bamboo Fun for about a month now and I have completely given up on using a mouse. The touchpad and gesture features are really very useful. It took me a couple of days to get used to this function but once the breakin period is over I find the functions quite intuitive. I will say that the touch function is somewhat sensitive at times and I would have liked to see some way to adjust the touch sensitivity in the pen tablet pref pane. I am a previous Wacom tablet user and there was no problem getting up to speed with this function which works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Albert J. Salzman

customer_reviews.title: A good place to start
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't have a ridiculous amount of sensitivity like the more expensive models, but the there is a large live area for the price. From my experience using it and watching others make amazing drawings on Youtube with this model, it's definitely a good place to start and maybe continue with for several years. I would pay the extra $20 or some bucks and get this model over the other Bamboo ones because it has touch and if your carrying around a laptop and a tablet at school, this could be faster for you to navigate than the touch pad on the laptop.
customer_reviews.author: ThisGuy

customer_reviews.title: He is very happy. So i highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: This product was purchased for my son as a birthday gift. He is an aspiring artist. We are running vista on his computer and this one ran flawlessly with that operating system. He is very happy. So i highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than a 4x6" but still jumpy and slow for digital painitng
customer_reviews.text: They could have made this better. It is worth maybe $75 not $150-200. This isn't even made by wacom anymore. They forced us all to get these instead of write 32bit drivers for the older 9-pin tablets (which worked better). 2000lpi is the base for fast digital painting and they purposefully made this not react to that in the circuit (timings0 so you would be forced to buy the intuos level 2-3x as expensive. in a pinch this will work, and does, but the intuos used is much better.
customer_reviews.author: Kristoffe Brodeur

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for all graphic designers and easy to use!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing! Shipping was fast provided by amazon! Being an up-and-coming graphic designer has been a struggle and this tablet has made the work more enjoyable and fun! It's really intuitive and easy to learn! There's no steep learning curve; it only took me roughly 20 minutes to get used to it. The surface is really large and capable of handling designing in Photoshop, Illustrator or InDesign at any level!! I only wish that this product was less expensive and that the stylus pen was more ergonomic for holding because my hand cramps up after 4-5 hours of continuous use....MAYBE Wacom can put the pen from the Inutos4 in this tablet and color it silver!!!
customer_reviews.author: K.Suto

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sweet
customer_reviews.text: I've had a lot of fun playing with this but the software was not good at all. You can buy or download software that is way better than what comes with it. Since I didn't want to spend the extra money I just searched for free downloads and did find some that worked well with this device. Using this drawing pad has sparked my creative interest and I've already made some nice drawings. It works well and not too clumsy to use. Being that it's my first drawing pad I was happy.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Kubes

customer_reviews.title: i love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I've never used a tablet before but this is so much better than using my laptops touchpad. I really don't like using a mouse so this is a perfect alternative. The pen is very responsive and there is a button to disable the "touch" recognition. The only thing I don't like are the buttons on the pen. They sometimes get in the way. But that might be my fault because I tend to twist the pen between my fingers (subconscious habit) overall great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Opentoideas

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed because the tablet it worm out and the pen ...
customer_reviews.text: Incomplete and it wasn't at it was shown in the picture. I am very disappointed because the tablet it worm out and the pen don't work in the tablet. I want my money back. There were not any receipt or instructions with the package.
customer_reviews.author: Maria R. acuña-Hilton

customer_reviews.title: Wacom Fun Tablet
customer_reviews.text: Great item. Exactly what an artist needs. Even someone who wants to write instead of using the keyboard. Can substitute as a mouse. Highlites, erases, everything your keyboard and mouse can do but quicker. My daughter is truly impressed by this item. When her laptop is plugged in and carried around her fun tablet is attached and going with her too. I bought it for her college bound days and upcoming graphics class. Also because in the next year (or two) we will be moving to a MACINTOSH and its also compatible with that. She would be lost without it....
customer_reviews.author: momzgiftz

customer_reviews.title: Works well and priced right
customer_reviews.text: The tablet adds the feature of touch which allows finger control over various screen, web and picture manipulations. If you're not used to using touch controls, as in the Apple iPhone, then it takes some getting used to. The tablet was even bigger and about half the price of a Wacom tablet I bought two years ago that did not have the touch control capability so I would say it's gotten to be a much better value.
customer_reviews.author: Proteanways

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I am a new user to a tablet so I was looking for something easy to use and would not break the bank! After researching other tablets in different sizes I decided on this one. I wanted something that I would not 'outgrow' too quickly. I recommend not going below this size tablet because this one seems to be just right. Most of my use will be Manga and will be looking to use it for other drawing ideas. It takes a little getting used to, but no more than a person first using a mouse. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: First Time
customer_reviews.text: First time we have bought a product like this. Came bundled with great software and we are still learning how to use some of it. Bought it for a teenagers birthday to encourage free hand drawing aspects. Seems to be working fine and she is using it -- so its a "WIN" with us! We tried it on in a retail store and found the best price online and shipping time worked out as promised.
customer_reviews.author: Reddly~

customer_reviews.title: Good device, bad software
customer_reviews.text: After installing the software for this, I have had to constantly reject popups related to this device and my firewall is continually getting requests from it to access or penetrate unrelated files. But it works well.
customer_reviews.author: international shopper

customer_reviews.title: A good tablet
customer_reviews.text: Has lasted me 3 years. Feels smooth but with the pen its ever so slightly grainy - that's a good thing. Occasional connection problems, restart computer and I'm fine. Press lightly and your nib will last ages.
customer_reviews.author: Balli

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought my wife this so she could continue her drawing hobby on the computer. Before she would hand sketch everything and then scan it in and draw over it in Illustrator. We bought this and it lets her do everything on the computer! It was very easy to set up and use on Windows 7 with both Illustrator and Photoshop.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Glonek

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade for me.
customer_reviews.text: This Drawing pad was an upgrade from my Bamboo connect and I love it. The big canvas is great, the buttons on the side are smart, and the touch pad on here is wonderful if you don't want to use your mouse. They supply you with 3 extra nibs, but I have been using mine for about a month now, and I barley see any damage done to the nib it started out with. This was a great buy, and if you're someone who is into drawing on the computer, this product will not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Thompson

customer_reviews.title: While I was a bit disappointed to not having an instruction book or manual included ...
customer_reviews.text: While I was a bit disappointed to not having an instruction book or manual included or even an invoice with payment info and sender info, the tablet works well.
customer_reviews.author: Richie Beans

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous product, needs to be in every home!
customer_reviews.text: I love how easy this product was to set up. I love the sleek design, the storage capability of the pen with the product instead of an individual pen holder. This product is so easy to use that my small children look to doodle with it using Art Rage. I recommend this to every person who has a computer! I wish I had gotten mine sooner.
customer_reviews.author: W. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Making digital art accessible
customer_reviews.text: I love, love, love my Wacom tablet. It's a great product at a great price which made what I used to think was expensive technology easily available to me. I might upgrade to a more expensive version at some point, but this in particular is a great starting model for the aspiring digital artist. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: E. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Oh My Goodness
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is a handful especially if you are a beginner, it gets a bit hard to handle at first but eventually you get use to it. It's worth the money and is really fun to work with. I enjoy sketching and other things, as an artist having a tablet for the first time is exciting, this tablet helps you build your knowledge so that once you're ready you can move on too something more professional such as an Intuos :) I ENJOY THIS TABLET AND I WOULD RECOMMEND IT TO OTHERS.
customer_reviews.author: CrysCarter

customer_reviews.title: AWESOMESAUCE
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I had some issues for a while with Windows not liking it, but Ubuntu gets along great with it, as long as I remember to use Touchpad Disabler to disable the touchpad while drawing with the pen. I would definitely get this again if I needed a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Fayanora

customer_reviews.title: photographer likes it
customer_reviews.text: I am a photographer and wanted to try a Tablet. Talked to a lot of graphic designers and some photographers about the difference between he higher end models and the bamboo. This works fine. I hardly use the pressure sensitivity to retouch so it doesn't matter how sensitive it is. So far I like it. 25 years of using a mouse takes time to change.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mouradian

customer_reviews.title: Bamboo tablet
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is pretty nifty especially if you don't want to spend a lot,it's not perfect but it works really well! I of course use it for photoshop for art purposes. It take awhile to get used to but you'll pick it up after a few uses. Easy to install too.
customer_reviews.author: Runningquiet

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought this one.
customer_reviews.text: Tablets are really coming down in price, with some being less than 50.00 USD. I'm glad I splurged a little and bought this one. It's feels intuitive. The fact that I can use my fingers on it as a touch pad makes it very fast. I find myself using it more and more and my mouse less and less. I'm left handed and it was just a simple click to have it set up the opposite (left) way. I'm not so hot on the surface texture, but I don't hate it either. I only use a tablet for fun projects, and this was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Joie

customer_reviews.title: Rtist
customer_reviews.text: As a graphic designer / illustrator I've used a Wacom tablet for years and I'm very happy with the product. After invasive hand surgery I've been forced to consider options other than a mouse or track ball for selecting and manipulating items on monitor, so when I saw your product online it looked like the perfect alternative to point and click. I enjoy using gestures on my Bamboo tablet and find it to be more ergonomically efficient than using a mouse. My only regret is that at least one of the commands will only work with Adobe CS4 and later. Also, it would be great if there was a hybrid tablet for professional illustrator / designers with a touch feature.
customer_reviews.author: Lillian Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my iMac an all my graphics programs: Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketchbook Pro, etc. At first the rough surface was eating through nibs really fast, so I looked for solutions, such as making new nibs out of weed whacker line, covering the tablet with smooth plastic, etc. However with use, the tablet has become smoother, so nib wear is not a concern anymore. It's the perfect size for my needs and if you want to see what I have created with it, feel free to visit Grafight at deviantar for examples of how this can be used for digital sketching, painting and design.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Ybarra

customer_reviews.title: Tablet is pretty good
customer_reviews.text: The condition of the tablet and the pen is pretty good the only thing I disliked about this purchase is the program disc. I bought my pc this March (2014) and it's windows 8, the program was made waaaaaaaaay back in 2009 and I wasn't able to use it. Of course, I won't be able to review the disc but I do have photoshop cs6 on my pc so it didn't bug m as much..... also some of my friends told me that the discs were pretty useless anyway and are only for amateurs.... so yeah.... ^ ^
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Kao

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed at just how easy it is to use. I have never used a tablet before so I was sure that writing on it and viewing it on the screen of another was going to be a transition. I took to it instantly. It was like writing on paper. I was writing and creating in no time. It's light, surprisingly larger than I expected and made pretty solid. The bundled software is great! I wanted something that I can draw with and feel totally natural while doing. This is one of my best buying decisions. I couldn't be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy

customer_reviews.title: Great for starting a portfolio!
customer_reviews.text: i bought this to get a portfolio started for myself. works great with pretty much any photoshop like programs out there. It's an amazing tablet and very durable. very sleek and thin and doesnt clutter too much if you have a small desk. GREAT BUY! highly recommended to young aspiring artists and portfolio starters :)
customer_reviews.author: Roman A. Sarmiento

customer_reviews.title: Even better than I expected!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second attempt at incorporating a touch pad / pen into my system. The first was a brand that shall remain in the recycling bin, where the product ended its' life. The Bamboo Fun has exceeded my expectation! I use it mostly with "Paint Shop Pro Photo X2". But, it works very well with all of my software. My System is: Windows XP with all the sevice packs and updates, P4 2.53MHz cpu & 2MB of RAM. Bottom line, I'm VERY happy with the Bamboo Fun! Larry L.
customer_reviews.author: LRL, Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: My kids ordered this to make a simple anime movie. They love it! We had some issues with the pen that came with it but that was quickly resolved. The tablet doesn't work with my laptop however, we had to use a higher end computer to get it to function properly. Overall, it is what it is and for the money that's great. Shipping was fast. The company we bought it from provided excellent customer service; would buy from them again
customer_reviews.author: Gaynor

customer_reviews.title: Wacom Bamboo Fun - Allows Creativity
customer_reviews.text: This is my first digital tablet. After extensive research, I decided to purchase the Wacom Bamboo Fun Tablet. After reading on-line reviews and comments along with on-line video demonstrations, I decided that the Wacom Bamboo Fun was the best starter tablet. I was right! It was easy to learn and use. It allows me to express my creative nature both in digital photography and drawing. I enjoy using it. Later I'll use it for drafting.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel B.

customer_reviews.title: I have loved the tablet, but am upset with Wacom
customer_reviews.text: A short has developed in the cord after only 9 months. I have emailed Wacom twice on their website about sending it for repair, as it should still be under warranty, but have gotten NO RESPONSE. I have enjoyed using the tablet, but it should last longer than this!!
customer_reviews.author: Wallabbie

customer_reviews.title: I like it, but it's taking time.
customer_reviews.text: The Bamboo does everything it advertises that it does. I formerly had one of the older tablets that included a mouse, as well as a pen. I am finding that it is taking some practice to get used to not using a mouse at all. I still have a mouse connected that I sometimes use when the Fun doesn't seem to quite give me the feel and control I am used to in email and Word applications. But the more I use the Fun, the more skilled I'm getting and the less I go for the mouse. The four side buttons are very useful. For Photoshop, the Fun is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Troy

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and seamless use both as a mouse and as a graphics pad with several pieces of software.
customer_reviews.text: I like how easy the setup was. BTW, the red tab in the photos, which I kept thinking was a piece of the hardware when I was researching the Bamboo, is the fabric loop for storing the stylus.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas R. Fries

customer_reviews.title: It's a Wacom
customer_reviews.text: What more is there to say? Awesome product at an amazing price. Obviously it's the lower end of Wacom tablets so you're missing a few functions such as higher pen pressure (which honestly isn't that big of a deal) and pen tilt which I consider to be the biggest kicker. I've got an Intuos at work and I don't use the tilt function enough to miss it at home. The layout of this tablet is nice to, makes working on it very easy. So as long as you know what you're getting, I highly doubt anyone would be disappointed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: G. Powers

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love this device. as someone who had a little money to spend, thank you new homebuyer's credit, and zero graphic design experience, my eyes have been opened wide. I did not know what I could do with a digital pen before. The ability to edit an customize media with a pen instead of a mouse is immense. Also, the touch pad function is remarkably handy on a pc. video editing was made incredibly fast and pictures were awesome to customize. not a bad price point too given that there are a lot more expensive options out there for the more adventurous. definitely will keep this pad handy.
customer_reviews.author: Reverend Destruction

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to digital art, and this is perfect! Very easy to use, very comfortable, and very smooth. It came with photoshop and a few other programs. I was very satisfied. I can see myself using this for quite awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Bat

customer_reviews.title: A word of warning to iMac owners
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 11 yr old daughter, and very quickly she has been creating drawings and learning to use the Bamboo Fun on her own. A word of warning, however, about difficult compatibility with the iMac wireless mouse and keyboard. These wireless devices seem to interfere with the TOUCH PAD function (not the much more important pen function). The touch pad does not work properly unless the wireless keyboard and mouse are turned off. This is not a big disadvantage for us, as we really bought it for its pen input features.
customer_reviews.author: Bartolo

customer_reviews.title: Works very well for the price
customer_reviews.text: The tablet really offers a lot more accuracy and control compared to the mouse. Easy to install and good work area. The Color Efex software is really just a tease to buy the full version (only 3 attributes to control with the basic bundle). But I did not buy it for the software. Great tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Cali Kurt

customer_reviews.title: I still prefer to draw on paper,
customer_reviews.text: I still prefer to draw on paper, the program that comes with it seems obsolete but the tablet itself works great
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M Feist

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool, pretty big. Works, good.
customer_reviews.text: It is a large tablet. solidly built. I like it, does much, best of touch and pen, with extra buttons. Good all around, and very affordable. I got barely a year out of it, and it quit letting me do touch, but the pen still works. It will bend over time, and if you get the larger one, with the wire, you will risk pulling it out of the tablet...Needs some other thought on that....It works, just the big one is awkward, and will bend, and once it starts to do that the touch will not work anymore...I was disappointed, but the pen works fairly well...for what I paid for, I recommend the smaller one.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Glenn Munro

customer_reviews.title: Touch feature is a mess
customer_reviews.text: Tablet's touch feature was always buggy and completely quit working 8 months after purchase. Tablet would no longer be recognized by any computer after 1 year. Nowhere near worth the $200 I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Margarita Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Good times
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good tablet for people who just want to casually draw and be artistic without spending tons of money on the higher end wacoms. The only problem is the nubb will ware out in a bit but they are not that hard to get replacements for.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie L

customer_reviews.title: Solid product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my daughter to use in her Artistic design class. She uses it with the Adobe suite of products and absolutely loves it. It's saving her wrist from using the mouse. This was a good purchase for her education!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and more!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for daughter. A learning pen/pencil artist. Works very well. Company very responsive and helpful on any issues. Like a lot of other computer hard/soft ware, it helps to reload/update every now and then. Daughter has taught self how to use. Lots of tutorial comes with tablet and on YouTube. Great, relatively inexpensive item good for beginners and then some!
customer_reviews.author: BDT

customer_reviews.title: Even better that I expected.
customer_reviews.text: I have absolutely no issues with this device. Well, I am not the actual user of it)))
customer_reviews.author: Zheng

customer_reviews.title: My Daughter Loves it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! My daughter loves it! It is just like drawing on a piece of paper for her. The screen is super sensitive to her touch, which she loves. This has a good amount of space for drawing as well. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Autonomous

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful tablet. If I had to buy it over again I would. I don't use it as much as I used to, but I love it. I definitely recommend it to new graphic artists.
customer_reviews.author: G Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Not good when comparing to my old Intuos3
customer_reviews.text: The surface is rough, not smooth like an Intuos. Also, when you have the Intuos3 also plugged in then the bamboo will no longer function correctly. It's good if you want a big touch pad, just not right for me.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I needed a tablet for freehand drawing in Anime Studio, Pencil, Illustrator, etc. and this one works great. The software that's included, and Amazon's reduced price, makes this tablet a good value. I'm using a Dell Studio 64 bit PC.
customer_reviews.author: Gary A. Woods

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet for the price
customer_reviews.text: I should say that I don't do much illustration anymore but I've grown accustomed to using a tablet as opposed to a mouse. So, that's mainly what I use this for on a daily basis. It's a nice size, is responsive and I've been pretty happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: designer.eb

customer_reviews.title: Simply Great!
customer_reviews.text: Don't even THINK about Photoshop with out it! This is not the best tablet out there, but it has tremendous value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: As a graphic designer, this Wacom Bamboo Fun Tablet has been my best friend for the last months. Is very easy to learn how to use, even if you're a first time tablet user. Totally recommended.
customer_reviews.author: SanDon7

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: First tablet I've ever bought. Bought it mostly for messing around with, I'm not really an artist. Awkward to use at first, looking at the screen instead of where you are drawing, but got used to it in minutes. The pen is some how battery free, which is great!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Used it in my art classes and the high school students used it every day. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: quietmidnight

customer_reviews.title: Fanastic, especially for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great alternative to the higher end Wacom pads offered by the company. Only a highly trained professional would notice the lack of pressure sensitivity, and only the most nit-picky designer would pay an extra $200 of their own money for it.
customer_reviews.author: Jay M. Decker

customer_reviews.title: Great introductory tablet for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Great introductory tablet for beginners. Has nearly the same specs as an Intuos 3, minus some minor features like tilt sensitivity.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but the pen nibs wear out REALLY quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Crazy Good to Have!
customer_reviews.text: This is the same model that my child has in school. So, that made using it easy from the start. It was also a fabulous thing to have so that she could do her own art work at home. A++
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia H-G

customer_reviews.title: Go Big with your Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this large tablet for my daughter, who loves to draw wolves, cats, and also Anime. Her friend has a small tablet (4x6"), but she said that it is too small to create a full drawing on it. When she saw this on Christmas morning, she was EXCITED!! A small tablet is good for playing around with, but an artist really needs the large drawing area! The sensitivity is excellent, and her drawings are awesome. I am so glad that she has this model (Wacom Bamboo Fun)!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Bower

customer_reviews.title: Bamboo Fun is amazing
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product for a little over a month and I have fell in love with it. It is the perfect tool for any of your artistic needs. I use mine with adobe illustrator and I spend hours creating things. If you are wondering if it's worth the money it most definitely is. It has a large drawing area and is extremely easy to use. The only draw back is that the nibs seem to where out a little more quickly then I imagined them to. This is something that every person interested in graphic design needs.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: an artist's friend
customer_reviews.text: gave wacom bamboo tablet to niece, who is a graphic designer, for Christmas and she is still raving about it. It's ease of use, it's fun applications, and the freedom to create that it enables.
customer_reviews.author: Sloppy Joe

customer_reviews.title: Good product, great for my kind of work.
customer_reviews.text: The Wacom Bamboo fun is an excellent tablet. It's size makes it very comfortable and it's really improved the quality of my work.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Fun to use for illustration, and takes the place of my mouse!
customer_reviews.text: Using my Wacom as I write! Super great tablet and amazingly easy to use... a quality product. I have used it every day for a few years and it is still in like new condition.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy A

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it a whole lot but it is very sensitive, easy to use, loads of features and a lot of bang for the buck and not too small.
customer_reviews.author: YIRMASTER

customer_reviews.title: Love It!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product! I love that it has a 'touch off' button so it only recognizes the pen, meaning you can rest your hand on the tablet and draw or write naturally. it really does feel like a real pencil and eraser is so realistic feeling I have to remind myself that it isn't rubber. I would highly recommend this product for anyone looking for a tablet!
customer_reviews.author: Starr

customer_reviews.title: A+++++
customer_reviews.text: More than pleased with this. 5 Stars easily...everything it said & more..can't go wrong with this...for the serious graphic designer & the novice
customer_reviews.author: Greg E. Sedbrook

customer_reviews.title: I'm so glad to have this
customer_reviews.text: As a graphic arts student, I am so glad to have this at home. It saves so much time, rather than having to stay and use the ones at school.
customer_reviews.author: Wennsday Thursday

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Not bad, takes a little getting used to, larger than I thought though which was good. definitely worth the price. Mind you, the extra software they give you is a nuisance as it keeps showing up each time you boot up your PC, you have to edit your msconfig file/start up items/and or the services control panel to turn it off.
customer_reviews.author: Laurence

customer_reviews.title: my first large tablet
customer_reviews.text: I have another smaller wacom tablet and this one is definitely worth the extra money. Finger gestures are awesome when it works(about 80% of the time) it's great but it fails to respond to some commands, and occasionally does a command I don't want. Drawing and navigating with the pen is A+, the best pen I've used, of course I don't have too much experience with others tablets. I would buy this again, because I like having backups to my cherished possessions.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Herreria

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: The tablet is great in my opinion, not a big fan of the pen but hey, for $200 I'm not really complaining. I got this about 11 months ago and I use it on a daily basis for about 8 to 9 hours a day ( masters in animation ) and it works great with Maya, Zbrush and especially photoshop. Want something better. Shell out more money. Want something that will get the job done but feels like plastic? Bamboo is your drug of choice.
customer_reviews.author: Heavy D

customer_reviews.title: I loved it and then it broke
customer_reviews.text: I've had this tablet for a few months. I've used it once or twice daily. I loved it, until it stop working. The tablet just stopped responding to the pen. What a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: KSB

customer_reviews.title: Good purchased
customer_reviews.text: Brought this for my daughter She wanted to be able to post some of her art work on line. This item does the job. Easy to use. Very good tutorial.
customer_reviews.author: Nita

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Item is as described, fast delivery! No issues with item or delivary.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Mayhemm

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Good price.
customer_reviews.text: Shipped on time and without issues. Great tablet for PC or Mac. Comes with Photoshop Elements and all needed drivers.
customer_reviews.author: jeff151012

customer_reviews.title: What a great tool.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I bought this for my 10yr old daughter for Christmas and the tablet has quickly become a family favorite. My only concern is that for some people with limited computer savvy, the included supporting programs may be troublesome to understand. My daughter's mom is a Graphic Designer familiar with the programs, so we were up and running with only a small learning curve.
customer_reviews.author: M. C. Dougherty

customer_reviews.title: Nice way to expose kids to the world of their own creation.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my daughters. The have since become art majors and has only recently broken down.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unique creativity
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter in law in Norway who is working on her MA in web design, she wrote back: Lots of fun!! A uniquely creative tool!
customer_reviews.author: Vera H. Olcott

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: As per my 12 yr old daughter, budding artist, this tablet works really well and is easy to use. She spends a lot of time using it and would recommend it to anyone interested in digital art. I was skeptical at first and wondered if it was worth the price but we got a good deal from Amazon and my daughter is really happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: MDP

customer_reviews.title: Great teblet
customer_reviews.text: It's my first tablet and I really love this one. It works greatly for me and it didn't costed much
customer_reviews.author: nino

customer_reviews.title: Stands up to its reputation
customer_reviews.text: Now I know why the pros use Wacom for photo editing. It allows me to do things not possible with a mouse or trackball. Count me as happy.
customer_reviews.author: Hoosier66

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: This product is as expected and was very easy to install. All functions work flawlessly with my MacBook pro laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Thousand Oaks, CA

customer_reviews.title: BAMBOO Fun Tablet
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. I use it with the Adobe Web Premium (Dw, Fw, Ai, Ps, Br, Sb, etc...) Works great especially when you need to do some freehand work.
customer_reviews.author: Don H. - St Petersburg FL

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: So glad I bought this. I would also recommend taking an online class or check out youtube to help you use this product to its full potential. My kids love doodling with it too!
customer_reviews.author: TL Briggs

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this almost every day for years with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Nestron

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: After much research on Bamboo tablets, I selected this one as my first. For the price, and for what I was looking for, it has been nothing short of exquisite. I've been using my tablet for about 4-5 months now and it still works as flawlessly as the day I opened it. Great product, in my opinion! A must have for any college art student.
customer_reviews.author: Kara M.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift to my brother which he loved. He said that it has great features and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Farid

customer_reviews.title: Simply awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Well, the touch isn't superb, but the tablet itself has a big place so you can draw on freely, ad 1024 pressure level, an eraser, everything is nice. I highly recommend this tablet if you can't afford Intuos.
customer_reviews.author: ComputerFondler2004

customer_reviews.title: No reason not to lke it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it as a Christmas present for my daughter. She is a college student and in graphic design. She says it blows away the ones they use at school so it must be good. Its very interesting to see all the cool things you can do with it. Plus I got it 30 dollars cheaper on Amazon - thanks Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: ohg8or

customer_reviews.title: Great precision.
customer_reviews.text: The tablet has a great natural feel to it with the perfect amount of precision. The multi-touch still needs work but is a great addition.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Craver

customer_reviews.title: Wacom Bamboo Tablet is a great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty impressed with the overall ease of use of this item. The price was slightly higher than I wanted to pay, but I'm glad I didn't go with the cheaper versions. They don't have as many features as this one did. I'm happy with what I got and I use it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Carla Wetherill

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: this is a great tablet for design. touch function is fun and confortable to use and pen is according my to hand.
customer_reviews.author: Vivian

customer_reviews.title: Good product but tablet pen already malfunctioning
customer_reviews.text: just purchased this for my daughter - an arts student, and the tablet pen is already malfunctioning and it is not covered under the warranty. Dissapointed! I think the entire product should be covered, especially since the item was just purchased.
customer_reviews.author: S. funkhouser

customer_reviews.title: wacom bamboo fun and touch tablet
customer_reviews.text: I am loving my new wacom bamboo fun and touch tablet. It takes a little getting used to and I miss the wheel on my mouse to increase or decrease the view of the pictures I am working on in Photoshop, however, I have no other complaints. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara D. Chapin

product_meta.title: Wacom Bamboo Fun Tablet
product_meta.description:
Bamboo Fun lets you get hands-on with your creative projects, giving you the benefits of Multi-Touch along with the comfort and precision of Wacom’s ergonomically-designed pen. With Multi-Touch, you can navigate, scroll, and work with simple gestures in an area larger than on mobile devices or laptop trackpads. For precision work, pick up the pressure-sensitive pen to draw, sketch, edit photos, and add handwritten elements to your creations. The generous size of Bamboo Fun gives you lots of space for creative freedom, making it simple and comfortable to use. Bamboo Fun works with your existing computer: desktop or laptop, PC or Mac. Attach it to a standard USB port and set it comfortably by your keyboard. You can even customize your Bamboo Fun experience by assigning your own shortcuts to the four ExpressKeys. Available in a stylish silver color, Bamboo Fun will complement your current setup. It includes valuable additions that make it ideal for your creative projects.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Combining intuitive design and versatility, the Bamboo Fun is a powerful creative workstation that lets PC and Mac users create digital art with an organic, hands-on feel. Using an innovative tablet and Wacom's "Multi-Touch" system, users can manipulate images and navigate the Web using simple gestures and finger taps. When combined with Wacom's pen-input technology, the Bamboo Fun allows you to write, doodle, and embellish with ease.

 



Included pen features 1,024 levels of pressure sensitivity for precise drawings. 

Large, textured work surface and customizable keys give you artistic control. 

Multi-Touch lets you scroll, zoom, and rotate your screen with simple hand gestures. Sleek, Stylish, and Easy to Use
Measuring 13.3 by 8.8 inches, the Bamboo Fun is compact enough to store comfortably in a laptop case. It features a large and responsive active area, providing enough workspace for even your most ambitious projects. For added convenience, four ExpressKeys provide quick access to user-defined shortcuts. The tablet comes with a battery-free pen with an easy-to-grip design, so you can have maximum control over your drawing. The work surface is textured, providing a pen-on-paper feel. It's also reversible, so you can use it comfortably whether you're right- or left-handed.

 The Bamboo Fun is simple to set up. Simply plug the tablet into your computer via a USB port, install the provided drivers, and you're ready to go. You'll be doodling, writing, and painting in minutes.

 Enhance Creativity with Multi-Touch Technology
With the Bamboo Fun, Wacom has implemented a new technology called Multi-Touch. Typically, tablets require you to use the stylus for navigation, but Multi-Touch provides a comfortable hands-on alternative. It allows you to quickly navigate through your computer with a single finger. You can also scroll, zoom, and rotate your screen with simple hand gestures. It's intuitively-designed and easy to use -- even if you're new to the touch experience.

 For precision work, you can use the included pen. When you use the pen, the screen will automatically recalibrate for more precise use. In your hands, the pen quickly becomes an all-purpose art tool. It features 1,024 levels of pressure sensitivity, allowing you to perform tasks ranging from fine hand-writing to wide-brush painting. You can add hand-drawn embellishments to your favorite photos, add life to your digital sketches, or provide a personal touch to your scrapbooking pages.

 First-Class Visual Editing Software
The tablet also comes with a full suite of visual editing software, including Adobe Photoshop Elements 7.0 Win/6.0 Mac and Nik Color Efex Pro 3.0 WE3--valued separately at several hundred dollars.

 Bamboo Fun is compatible with Windows 7, Windows Vista, Windows XP (Service Pack 2) and Mac OS X (10.4.8 or higher.) It requires a powered USB drive, a colored screen, and a CD/DVD drive.

 What's in the Box
Bamboo Fun tablet, Bamboo Fun pen, Quick Start guide, installation CD (includes driver software, interactive tutorial and user's manual), and software DVD.
feature_bullets: Powerful tablet helps you create digital art, embellish photos, draw by hand, and more
Intuitive Multi-Touch system lets you navigate your computer using just your fingertips
Included stylus features 1,024 levels of pressure sensitivity; provides a pen-on-paper feel
Compatible with Windows 7, Windows Vista, Windows XP (Service Pack 2), and Mac OS X (10.4.8 or higher)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars239 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
